title: Successful Vega C Launch Delivers ESA Biomass Satellite to Orbit
summary:
An Avio-built Vega C rocket was launched from the Guiana Space Centre in French Guiana on 29 April, successfully delivering the European Space Agency’s Biomass to orbit. The 35-metre-tall Vega C rocket was launched from the ELV launch pad at 11:15 CET. Approximately 57 minutes after liftoff, the 1,131-kilogram Biomass satellite was deployed into Sun-synchronous […]
The post Successful Vega C Launch Delivers ESA Biomass Satellite to Orbit appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA Soars to New Heights in First 100 Days of Trump Administration
summary: Today is the 100th day of the Trump-Vance Administration after being inaugurated on Jan. 20. title: NASA Invites Media to Agency’s 25th Annual Student Launch Challenge
summary: NASA’s annual Student Launch challenge will bring middle school, high school, and college students from around the country together to launch high-powered rockets and payloads. On Saturday, May 3, from 8:30 a.m.-2:30 p.m. CDT (or until the last rocket launches), student teams will convene for the agency’s 25th annual challenge at Bragg Farms in Toney, Alabama, near […]

title: Help Classify Galaxies Seen by NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope!
summary: NASA needs your help identifying the shapes of thousands of galaxies in images taken by our James Webb Space Telescope with the Galaxy Zoo project. These classifications will help scientists answer questions about how the shapes of galaxies have changed over time, what caused these changes, and why. Thanks to the light collecting power of […]

title: Gaia spots odd family of stars desperate to leave home
Where Does Gold Come From? NASA Data Has Clues
summary: Since the big bang, the early universe had hydrogen, helium, and a scant amount of lithium. Later, some heavier elements, including iron, were forged in stars. title: Apex raises $200 million to accelerate satellite production
summary:
Apex has raised $200 million in a new funding round intended to help the company accelerate production of satellite buses.

title: Amazon establishes contact with first operational Kuiper satellites
summary:
Amazon said April 29 it has made contact with its first 27 operational Project Kuiper broadband satellites, after being dropped off in low Earth orbit by ULA's Atlas V rocket.
The post Amazon establishes contact with first operational Kuiper satellites appeared first on SpaceNews.
